channel.title: Pathways to progress: The Great Lakes
channel.description:
A 13-part documentary drama about the economic impact of the Great Lakes region in the United State.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: Pathways to progress: The Great Lakes

item.title: They put the world on wheels
item.description: This program looks at automobiles, their history, and the close connection between the Great Lakes region and the growth of the automobile industry.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Nutrition for the nation
item.description: This program looks at how meat, dairy, and corn are essential parts of the Great Lakes economy.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Packing-houses

item.title: Region of the inland seas
item.description: This program gives a general overview of the Great Lakes region and its characteristics.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Water resources development

item.title: The peoples of the region
item.description: This program focuses on the people who live in the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Finders of the region
item.description: This program, "Exploration of the Region," dramatizes the early European explorations of the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Water resources development

item.title: Frontier of fine arts
item.description: This program focuses on the growth of culture and fine art in the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Lifelines of the Lakes
item.description: This program focuses on the various modes of transportation that drive life and work in the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Wealth in the ground
item.description: This program focuses on minerals and their place in the economy of the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Chemistry creates progress
item.description: This program explores the ways that the Great Lakes region takes advantage of its natural resources in order to be a major chemical industry center.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Steel builds a new economy
item.description: This program focuses on the steel industry and its place in the Great Lakes region.
item.dc:creator: Kushler, Dave
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century
